description: Follow the action as it unfolded as five-try Ireland overcome Italy 31-17 in their opening World Cup warm-up game at the Aviva Stadium.
title: Ireland beat Italy in Dublin warm-up - as it happened
title_page: Ireland beat Italy in Dublin warm-up - as it happened - BBC Sport
maintext:
Final whistle
FT Ireland 33-17 Italy
That's the first World Cup warm-up game done and dusted and on the whole a decent performance from the hosts.
Man-of-the-match Caelan Doris went over twice while Dave Kilcoyne, Stuart McCloskey and Cian Healy also bagging tries for Andy Farrell's team.
That's all from us for now - thanks for your company,
Full-time
Ireland 33-17 Italy
Ireland chalk up a comfortable victory in their opening World Cup warm-up match.
Ireland come away with five tries and some impressive individual performances but some rustiness was evident from both sides, not helped by slippery conditions.
Italy threatened to fight their way back into the game in the second half with some promising attacking play particularly in the third quarter.
Ireland's combination of youth and experience proved too much for the Italians, however, and the performance will give Andy Farrell plenty to think about as he prepares his side for the next two games against England and Samoa on the 19th August and 26th August respectively in preparation for the World Cup.
Post
Ireland 33-17 Italy
Italy continue to fight back as Ireland concede successive penalties on their own line.
Just as they look in danger of conceding a third try, Tom Stewart secures an important turnover.
Ireland will now look to close out the game as full-time approaches.
Try Ireland 33-17 Italy
Caelan Doris
Ireland hit back immediately as they work their way up the pitch, stretching the Italian defence with a slick move down the left wing.
Prendergast and Nash combined well and then a bounce pass from Healy finds Doris who crashes over for his second try of the game.
Frawley takes on the kicking duties and converts.
Converted try Ireland 26-17 Italy
Tommaso Menoncello
Menoncello shows his power, spinning out of a tackle to crash over and put his side back in the game.
Tommaso Allan is accurate with the boot to keep his side within touching distance.
Post
Ireland 21-10 Italy
Italy work their way up the field but Tadhg Beirne forces a turnover at the breakdown.
Ireland surge forward once again and Italy concede a penalty.
They kick to the corner and Ireland set up a driving maul, with Tom Stewart peeling off the back and powers his way towards the line...
Try Ireland 21-10 Italy
Lorenzo Pani
Pani scores a deserved Italian try following a spell of possession in Ireland's 22.
Italy use the lineout maul as a platform and get it wide to Pani, who demonstrates his pace to score in the corner.
Allan kicks a difficult conversion to bring Italy back into the game.
